LEAR CORP., Southfield, Mich., , the world's No. 1 maker of automotive interiors, sold its exterior-mirror business, which has annual sales of more than $50 million, to the company's joint venture with the closely held Bing Group for an undisclosed price.

ADELPHIA COMMUNICATIONS CORP., Coudersport, Pa., the sixth-largest United States cable company, plans to buy television set-top boxes, modems and other equipment valued at $535 million from Motorola Inc., Schaumburg, Ill., through next December.

INSWEB CORP., an online insurance marketplace, said it planned to reduce its work force by about 40 percent, or 120 employees, in the next two quarters and discontinue operations of its Benelytics Inc. unit.
